com.wordpress._0x10f8.logcheck.rule

Class CompositeRule

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wordpress._0x10f8.logcheck.rule.AbstractRule
      • com.wordpress._0x10f8.logcheck.rule.CompositeRule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Rule

    public class CompositeRule
extends AbstractRule
    A composite rule is a rule which is made up of other rules. The composite result of these rules is either the logical OR or logical AND result of the subset of results.

      • evaluate

        public java.util.List<RuleMatch> evaluate(java.io.File logFile)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Evaluate the log file using all of the rules within this composite rule and then produce a final result list using the logical operation specified
        Parameters:
        logFile - The log file
        Returns:
        A list of rule matches indicating where in the log file matched the rule
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there was an exception reading the log file
